title: I can't seem to find this font anywhere, can anyone help me?
content:
I need to track down this font which has been scanned off a T-shirt design from the 70s. I have found it in a Typefinder book and they have named it Blanchard but I can't seem to find it! Can anyone help?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 6.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707145554/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%206_33.png) | 20.92 KB |
author: jaemi

comments.content:
Yer. It was called Blanchard Solid as a Letraset font.  
Could well be that it didn’t make it to digital.

The Solotype catalog shows this under the name Zorba and the only digital version by any name that I'm aware of is Zorba on the [24 Bold Script Display Fonts CD](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707145554/http:/store.doverpublications.com/0486999769.html) by Dover/Dan Solo.

Note that if you click on the image at the URL above, you'll get a larger image and a few letters from Zorba can be seen on the cover of the book.
